00028 #include "lquota_internal.h"
00029 
00030 #ifndef _QSD_INTERNAL_H
00031 #define _QSD_INTERNAL_H
00032 
00033 struct qsd_type_info;
00034 struct qsd_fsinfo;
00035 
00036 /*
00037  * A QSD instance implements quota enforcement support for a given OSD.
00038  * The instance can be created via qsd_init() and then freed with qsd_fini().
00039  * This structure gathers all quota parameters and pointers to on-disk indexes
00040  * required on quota slave to:
00041  * i. acquire/release quota space from the QMT;
00042  * ii. allocate this quota space to local requests.
00043  */
00044 struct qsd_instance {
00045         /* name of service which created this qsd instance */
00046         char                     qsd_svname[MAX_OBD_NAME];
00047 
00048         /* pool ID is always 0 for now */
00049         int                      qsd_pool_id;
00050 
00051         /* dt_device associated with this qsd instance */
00052         struct dt_device        *qsd_dev;
00053 
00054         /* procfs directory where information related to the underlying slaves
00055          * are exported */
00056         struct proc_dir_entry   *qsd_proc;
00057 
00058         /* export used for the connection to quota master */
00059         struct obd_export       *qsd_exp;
00060 
00061         /* ldlm namespace used for quota locks */
00062         struct ldlm_namespace   *qsd_ns;
00063 
00064         /* on-disk directory where to store index files for this qsd instance */
00065         struct dt_object        *qsd_root;
00066 
00067         /* We create 2 quota slave instances:
00068          * - one for user quota
00069          * - one for group quota
00070          *
00071          * This will have to be revisited if new quota types are added in the
00072          * future. For the time being, we can just use an array. */
00073         struct qsd_qtype_info   *qsd_type_array[MAXQUOTAS];
00074 
00075         /* per-filesystem quota information */
00076         struct qsd_fsinfo       *qsd_fsinfo;
00077 
00078         /* link into qfs_qsd_list of qfs_fsinfo */
00079         struct list_head         qsd_link;
00080 
00081         /* list of lqe entry which might need quota space adjustment */
00082         struct list_head         qsd_adjust_list;
00083 
00084         /* lock protecting adjust list */
00085         spinlock_t               qsd_adjust_lock;
00086 
00087         /* dedicated thread for updating slave index files. */
00088         struct ptlrpc_thread     qsd_upd_thread;
00089 
00090         /* list of update tasks */
00091         struct list_head         qsd_upd_list;
00092 
00093         /* r/w spinlock protecting:
00094          * - the state flags
00095          * - the qsd update list
00096          * - the deferred list
00097          * - flags of the qsd_qtype_info */
00098         rwlock_t                 qsd_lock;
00099 
00100         /* Default quota settings which apply to all identifiers */
00101         /* when blk qunit reaches this value, later write reqs from client
00102          * should be sync. b=16642 */
00103         unsigned long            qsd_sync_threshold;
00104 
00105         /* how long a service thread can wait for quota space.
00106          * value dynamically computed from obd_timeout and at_max if not
00107          * enforced here (via procfs) */
00108         int                      qsd_timeout;
00109 
00110         unsigned long            qsd_is_md:1,    /* managing quota for mdt */
00111                                  qsd_started:1,  /* instance is now started */
00112                                  qsd_prepared:1, /* qsd_prepare() successfully
00113                                                   * called */
00114                                  qsd_exp_valid:1,/* qsd_exp is now valid */
00115                                  qsd_stopping:1, /* qsd_instance is stopping */
00116                                  qsd_acct_failed:1; /* failed to set up acct
00117                                                      * for one quota type */
00118 };
00119 
00120 /*
00121  * Per-type quota information.
00122  * Quota slave instance for a specific quota type. The qsd instance has one such
00123  * structure for each quota type (i.e. user & group).
00124  */
00125 struct qsd_qtype_info {
00126         /* reference count incremented by each user of this structure */
00127         atomic_t                 qqi_ref;
00128 
00129         /* quota type, either USRQUOTA or GRPQUOTA
00130          * immutable after creation. */
00131         int                      qqi_qtype;
00132 
00133         /* Global index FID to use for this quota type */
00134         struct lu_fid            qqi_fid;
00135 
00136         /* Slave index FID allocated by the master */
00137         struct lu_fid            qqi_slv_fid;
00138 
00139         /* back pointer to qsd device
00140          * immutable after creation. */
00141         struct qsd_instance     *qqi_qsd;
00142 
00143         /* handle of global quota lock */
00144         struct lustre_handle     qqi_lockh;
00145 
00146         /* Local index files storing quota settings for this quota type */
00147         struct dt_object        *qqi_acct_obj; /* accounting object */
00148         struct dt_object        *qqi_slv_obj;  /* slave index copy */
00149         struct dt_object        *qqi_glb_obj;  /* global index copy */
00150 
00151         /* Current object versions */
00152         __u64                    qqi_slv_ver; /* slave index version */
00153         __u64                    qqi_glb_ver; /* global index version */
00154 
00155         /* per quota ID information. All lquota entry are kept in a hash table
00156          * and read from disk on cache miss. */
00157         struct lquota_site      *qqi_site;
00158 
00159         /* Reintegration thread */
00160         struct ptlrpc_thread     qqi_reint_thread;
00161 
00162         /* statistics on operations performed by this slave */
00163         struct lprocfs_stats    *qqi_stats;
00164 
00165         /* deferred update for the global index copy */
00166         struct list_head         qqi_deferred_glb;
00167         /* deferred update for the slave index copy */
00168         struct list_head         qqi_deferred_slv;
00169 
00170         /* Various flags representing the current state of the slave for this
00171          * quota type. */
00172         unsigned long            qqi_glb_uptodate:1, /* global index uptodate
00173                                                         with master */
00174                                  qqi_slv_uptodate:1, /* slave index uptodate
00175                                                         with master */
00176                                  qqi_reint:1;    /* in reintegration or not */
00177 
00178         /* A list of references to this instance, for debugging */
00179         struct lu_ref            qqi_reference;
00180 };
00181 
00182 /*
00183  * Per-filesystem quota information
00184  * Structure tracking quota enforcement status on a per-filesystem basis
00185  */
00186 struct qsd_fsinfo {
00187         /* filesystem name */
00188         char                    qfs_name[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
00189 
00190         /* what type of quota is enabled for each resource type. */
00191         unsigned int            qfs_enabled[LQUOTA_NR_RES];
00192 
00193         /* list of all qsd_instance for this fs */
00194         struct list_head        qfs_qsd_list;
00195         struct mutex            qfs_mutex;
00196 
00197         /* link to the global quota fsinfo list.  */
00198         struct list_head        qfs_link;
00199 
00200         /* reference count */
00201         int                     qfs_ref;
00202 };
00203 
00204 /*
00205  * Helper functions & prototypes
00206  */
00207 
00208 /* helper routine to find qsd_instance associated a lquota_entry */
00209 static inline struct qsd_qtype_info *lqe2qqi(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00210 {
00211         LASSERT(!lqe_is_master(lqe));
00212         return (struct qsd_qtype_info *)lqe->lqe_site->lqs_parent;
00213 }
00214 
00215 /* qqi_getref/putref is used to track users of a qqi structure  */
00216 static inline void qqi_getref(struct qsd_qtype_info *qqi)
00217 {
00218         atomic_inc(&qqi->qqi_ref);
00219 }
00220 
00221 static inline void qqi_putref(struct qsd_qtype_info *qqi)
00222 {
00223         LASSERT(atomic_read(&qqi->qqi_ref) > 0);
00224         atomic_dec(&qqi->qqi_ref);
00225 }
00226 
00227 #define QSD_RES_TYPE(qsd) ((qsd)->qsd_is_md ? LQUOTA_RES_MD : LQUOTA_RES_DT)
00228 
00229 /* udpate record for slave & global index copy */
00230 struct qsd_upd_rec {
00231         struct list_head        qur_link; /* link into qsd_upd_list */
00232         union lquota_id         qur_qid;
00233         union lquota_rec        qur_rec;
00234         struct qsd_qtype_info  *qur_qqi;
00235         struct lquota_entry    *qur_lqe;
00236         __u64                   qur_ver;
00237         bool                    qur_global;
00238 };
00239 
00240 /* Common data shared by qsd-level handlers. This is allocated per-thread to
00241  * reduce stack consumption.  */
00242 struct qsd_thread_info {
00243         union lquota_rec                qti_rec;
00244         union lquota_id                 qti_id;
00245         struct lu_fid                   qti_fid;
00246         struct ldlm_res_id              qti_resid;
00247         struct ldlm_enqueue_info        qti_einfo;
00248         struct lustre_handle            qti_lockh;
00249         __u64                           qti_slv_ver;
00250         struct lquota_lvb               qti_lvb;
00251         union {
00252                 struct quota_body       qti_body;
00253                 struct idx_info         qti_ii;
00254         };
00255         char                            qti_buf[MTI_NAME_MAXLEN];
00256 };
00257 
00258 extern struct lu_context_key qsd_thread_key;
00259 
00260 static inline
00261 struct qsd_thread_info *qsd_info(const struct lu_env *env)
00262 {
00263         struct qsd_thread_info *info;
00264 
00265         info = lu_context_key_get(&env->le_ctx, &qsd_thread_key);
00266         if (info == NULL) {
00267                 lu_env_refill((struct lu_env *)env);
00268                 info = lu_context_key_get(&env->le_ctx, &qsd_thread_key);
00269         }
00270         LASSERT(info);
00271         return info;
00272 }
00273 
00274 /* helper function to check whether a given quota type is enabled */
00275 static inline int qsd_type_enabled(struct qsd_instance *qsd, int type)
00276 {
00277         int     enabled, pool;
00278 
00279         LASSERT(qsd != NULL);
00280         LASSERT(type < MAXQUOTAS);
00281 
00282         if (qsd->qsd_fsinfo == NULL)
00283                 return 0;
00284 
00285         pool = qsd->qsd_is_md ? LQUOTA_RES_MD : LQUOTA_RES_DT;
00286         enabled = qsd->qsd_fsinfo->qfs_enabled[pool - LQUOTA_FIRST_RES];
00287 
00288         return enabled & (1 << type);
00289 }
00290 
00291 /* helper function to set new qunit and compute associated qtune value */
00292 static inline void qsd_set_qunit(struct lquota_entry *lqe, __u64 qunit)
00293 {
00294         if (lqe->lqe_qunit == qunit)
00295                 return;
00296 
00297         lqe->lqe_qunit = qunit;
00298 
00299         /* With very large qunit support, we can't afford to have a static
00300          * qtune value, e.g. with a 1PB qunit and qtune set to 50%, we would
00301          * start pre-allocation when 512TB of free quota space remains.
00302          * Therefore, we adapt qtune depending on the actual qunit value */
00303         if (qunit == 0)                         /* if qunit is NULL           */
00304                 lqe->lqe_qtune = 0;             /*  qtune = 0                 */
00305         else if (qunit == 1024)                 /* if 1MB or 1K inodes        */
00306                 lqe->lqe_qtune = qunit >> 1;    /*  => 50%                    */
00307         else if (qunit <= 1024 * 1024)          /* up to 1GB or 1M inodes     */
00308                 lqe->lqe_qtune = qunit >> 2;    /*  => 25%                    */
00309         else if (qunit <= 4 * 1024 * 1024)      /* up to 16GB or 16M inodes   */
00310                 lqe->lqe_qtune = qunit >> 3;    /*  => 12.5%                  */
00311         else                                    /* above 4GB/4M               */
00312                 lqe->lqe_qtune = 1024 * 1024;   /*  value capped to 1GB/1M    */
00313 
00314         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "changing qunit & qtune");
00315 
00316         /* turn on pre-acquire when qunit is modified */
00317         lqe->lqe_nopreacq = false;
00318 }
00319 
00320 /* helper function to set/clear edquot flag */
00321 static inline void qsd_set_edquot(struct lquota_entry *lqe, bool edquot)
00322 {
00323         lqe->lqe_edquot = edquot;
00324         if (edquot)
00325                 lqe->lqe_edquot_time = cfs_time_current_64();
00326 }
00327 
00328 #define QSD_WB_INTERVAL 60 /* 60 seconds */
00329 
00330 /* helper function calculating how long a service thread should be waiting for
00331  * quota space */
00332 static inline int qsd_wait_timeout(struct qsd_instance *qsd)
00333 {
00334         if (qsd->qsd_timeout != 0)
00335                 return qsd->qsd_timeout;
00336         return min_t(int, at_max / 2, obd_timeout / 2);
00337 }
